title: "I'm done with League of Legends"
body:
I was rewatching Dunkey's vids, and got to the then-controversial "I'm done with League of Legends" video, posted by dunkey about 2 years ago.
Look at the complaints, at 1:58, 3:20, and his general view on League.
Ignore the PB&M parts.

>Why League Sucks (1:58):
-Deathtimers are too short
-Bounty system punishes getting fed
 -Turrets are annoying (implied that they get in the way, based on context)
 -Ranked system doesn't work at all


"..the match streches to the 40-50 minutes mark, and nobody cares at that point; the match has just gone on for way too long. Every time"
"So I'm not enjoying the game. No one I'm playing with is enjoying the game... league has lost its magic for me"

These are all things (outside of a bad ranked system) that the Boards have been asking for a while, but they're the reasons that Dunkey disliked the game.

I really don't think people are ever going to stop hating and complaining about the game. Everyone wants the game to suit what they want, not what everyone else wants. Whenever people try to speak for others, it's often just a way to try and make their point seem more valid.

People want the game to be tailored to them specifically. Riot tries to cater to everyone, but can't. Everyone hates and complains about the game because it isn't centered around them.

You play bruisers right now, you're going to hate this game state. You'd love it a lot more if it were 2 years ago.
You play supports right now, and you're going to be _much more_ happier than the supports in ye olde days.

Even when the conditions are generally good for whatever class or set of champions people like, they still find reason to complain, because the game isn't fully molded to their ideal of what the game should be. 

Videogames encourage people to be selfish assholes looking to have fun, often without consideration for the randoms they get paired with. League and other multiplayer games always try to cater to everyone's complaints , and fail.

Even if Riot does what the Boards are asking them to do, no matter how radical the change, you will still have a ton of complaints.

But you really shouldn't blame Riot or accuse them of being some malignant force trying to oust you and your champs. They're trying their best, and they can hear your complaints. They just can't satisfy everyone or change the game to be 100% based around you and your views.

Video is here, but I can't place it as a discussion link or have it be embedded due to temporary Board issues.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VjzgbZL12VI&list=PLMBTl5yXyrGQTBDqpquLgLpgmuall8yUI

replies.body:
Here are some of the facts on the matter. Riot can never please everybody. If games are short, people will flood the Boards demanding for longer games. If games are long, people will flood the Boards asking for shorter games. If snowballing is rampant, people are going to ask for anti snowballing mechanics. If you can't snowball, people are going to complain that this game is too harsh on solo players.

Here is another fact on the matter. Nobody who goes on Gameplay is entirely happy with the state of the game. People will always flood gameplay with everything they hate.

The Gameplay board is a meme at this point. Even thinking for a moment that we should take this Board seriously at this point is either much too ignorant or much too biased.

This.

I think it's a little inconsiderate to call it a meme. The opinions often can be justified and/or thought-out (some aren't, but..).

It's just not going to realistically be implemented by Riot.

>The opinions often can be justified and/or thought-out (some aren't, but..).

Here's the thing. They _can_ be. But if you follow the vast majority of posts, most aren't. In rare cases, some players _refuse_ to justify their arguments with evidence or reasoning or argue against any and all contrary evidence. Effectively this makes the vast majority of Gameplay garbage, or quite frankly, a meme.

People don't like games stretching out to 50 minutes, because we liked the average of 35 minutes. 

Death timers weren't really too short, he just played top and dealt with old TP pre-nerf. 

The bounty system is better now because it's dividing the gold among the team but should only divide it among those involved.

I think by "turrets are annoying" he meant how they block you when pathing, a-clicking, and trying to dive you sometimes click them because the person is hiding behind them. 

Don't forget, this was also season 5, the season where the tank meta was a thing, meaning towers didn't take as much damage and games were slower in favor of tanks in long teamfights. This is an ideal situation, minus the tank meta part.
Speak for yourself; I like 50 minute games.
Why?

By 50 minutes, most of the time everyone has full build, so the outcome of the game is more about who is more skilled, who can set up fights better, which team does better in vision, which team know better how to secure objectives, protect their base, etc.  

At that point it's more about skill and experience and game knowledge than about who got the first 3 ganks.
But wouldnt the result be to get you full build faster so that you can do things faster? So that you dont have to spend your time for a whole hour for 1 game?

I'm not sure about you, but I enjoy the slow buildup to late game.  The push and pull of trades.  The mistakes made by both sides being capitalized on to get that next turret, that next objective.  That moment just before a teamfight when you're trying to set up, trying to get that good engage, but also trying to avoid their engages.  Managing the waves in all 3 lanes while trying to maintain a solid group for potential teamfights.  

Not sure about you, but I enjoy the buildup to late game, the knowledge that the teams are fairly equal, and that you have to put in that little bit extra effort, pay attention a little closer, and be on your toes if you want to win.

Once I get full items, I expect the game to end very, very soon. There is no more progression left, killing minions/monsters is pointless beyond achieving a push, no more joy derivied. You talk of back and forths, but that happens in the mid game. Late game are people dancing around for minutes, doing nothing, scared shitless because they know one wrong fight is game over. That’s the point where the game stops being fun and it’s time to end.

On average, I hit full build at 40-45 mins. Games should not last much longer than that. DotA might be your cup of tea if you enjoy 60+ minute slogfests.

Personally I just dont prefer spending an hour of my time doing something im stuck in. Dont get me wrong 20min games suck as well. But being stuck in a game for a gross amount of time quite honestly sucks.

True 60min games have a lot of back and forth and CAN be fun, but as a standard its awful.

It's exciting, you do a ton of damage, heal/shield for a ton, run at people super fast, and it's just super dramatic.  Some champions can also get super tanky for the late game, and have fun just tanking the enemy team while allies clean up.
Copied from the person next to you: But wouldnt the result be to get you full build faster so that you can do things faster? So that you dont have to spend your time for a whole hour for 1 game?

I also like some buildup to it.  The climax of a story isn't so exciting if there are never any slow moments.

It's also fun to have a little 1v1 (or 2v2) test of skill early on.  At this point, that may exist up to level 3, but after that, jungler intervention becomes a massive influence on the lane generally.
I get bored after 40 minutes honestly, because most of those games it's more a case of nobody is grouping for objectives.

I'm just tired of the absurd damage and movement ability spam.  It repeatedly creates situations that, in my opinion, change they way league is played on a fundamental level.  Change is not always bad, but in this case it creates situations where most of the champions that i played and loved get so outclassed in the "movement ability spam" department that my only available counterplay is to avoid getting within sight, not to be confused with range, of them.  Smart positioning has changed from knowing another champ's strengths and weaknesses to assuming that you'll get one shot if a movement spam champ gets within sight of you.  Not surprisingly, it's not just affecting Gold support mains, like me.  It seems to be causing havoc on other roles/ranks and other aspects of the game, too.  Aspects i didn't even get a chance to fully learn yet and can't really comment on their validity.  I've said this before in another post, but, maybe these changes make sense for Riot, fiscally.  If that's the case, and i'm starting to think it is (without any real proof other than the fact that this has been a slow process of 2+ years concerning damage creep while considering movement ability spam of almost all new champs), then there's really nothing left for me to do but say the long farewell to LoL while crossing my fingers that this mess gets cleaned up, eventually.  I'm not holding my breath.  BTW, thanks for you lulu advice 'way back when' <3

I think the bigger issue is that if you're not picking or playing meta, you're probably trolling.

Your case was just an instance of this meta right now.
Do you mind and have time to elaborate on that please?  Thx in advance

In Ardent Cancer meta if you're not an enchanter **who is also rusing Ardent Censer the very first thing**, you are trolling and is literally making your team lose.

In Lethality meta if you're not Varus or Jhin as the ADC, you're trolling and is also making your team lose because they are the only ADCs who can do anything w/o getting jumped on to uselessness. Not building Lethality on either of them is also trolling because your damage is going to be shit.

The two most notable examples from the top of my head, but I'm pretty sure there's more.

thx again for the response and sorry it took me so long to reply.  I think i agree that my situation is effected by the meta(s), however, I think I'd still argue that it's deeper than that, too.  Over the last few years, changes have been made that, in my opinion, fundamentally changed the way one needs to play LoL to win and I don't enjoy it.  Winning isn't necessarily the crux here, either.  It's the style of play induced by the purpose of winning.

Elaborating a bit more;  The meta changes, yes, but effects of each meta linger.  It's the effects of the last 2 years of meta that have fundamentally changed the game, for me.

Sadly that's what happens to every game that goes MLG or has a pro scene. It then becomes only about money. Sure making money is good, but when money gets involved in a big way, like e-sports/mlg. Then the quality of the game starts to go down after a point. It happened to Gears, WoW pvp, and Halo and its happening to LoL. This is why you don't try to make games into a sport, money/greed corrupts it, just like it does everything else. 

So really us old guys have two choices, stop playing and let the game completely rot; because lets be honest here. LoL is 7 years old. Chances of it still being around in 5 years are minimal at best. What WoW did was very rare, its very, very, rare for a game to live as long as it did and has, mostly that is due to the massive amount of content that gets added with an expansion. But LoL doesn't have that. To be honest, you can only crap on you core loyal fan base so much before they leave and it doesn't matter how many new players you get. You can never replace your loyal fan base. A fact that companies seem to have forgotten. The other choice is to suffer through it and just go through the motions in a hallow way, not really caring or putting in effort. So its just a damned if you do and damned if you don't.
